thread.section_title: Palm Beach County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Park Vista runs over Spanish River
thread.title_full: Park Vista runs over Spanish River - Sun Sentinel

author: Mike May
title: Park Vista runs over Spanish River
text:
Park Vista running back Corey Cola ran for three touchdowns to lead the Cobras to a 42-6 victory over Spanish River in a District 10-8A game on Friday.
The Cobras (3-5, 2-3 in district), controlled the game with their running attack which produced 229 rushing yards.
In the first half, the Cobras scored a touchdown on all five of their drives to lead 35-0 at halftime.
Park Vista set the tone for the game with its opening possession -- a 16-play, 75-yard drive, which lasted more than seven minutes. The drive was capped by Cola's two-yard run. Cola added a second touchdown run on Park Vista's next drive and a third TD midway through the second quarter.
Park Vista quarterback John Smith also had a good game as he passed for a touchdown and ran for another.
The Cobras defense was defiant as it held Spanish River to 145 yards of total offense and grabbed three interceptions.
Spanish River (4-4, 1-4) finally scored with less than two minutes to go in the game on a six-yard pass from Owen Levine to Demetrius Garozzo.
